intro: Calcitrapa cilicica, commonly known as the Cilician bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, showcasing its adaptability to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Calcitrapa cilicica is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
